env.name: ASF_CRYPTKEY
env.label: ASF_CRYPTKEY
env.description: will start ASF with custom cryptographic key of <ASF_CRYPTKEY> value. This option affects security and will cause ASF to use your custom provided <ASF_CRYPTKEY> key instead of default one hardcoded into the executable. Since this property affects default encryption key (for encrypting purposes) as well as salt (for hashing purposes), keep in mind that everything encrypted/hashed with this key will require it to be passed on each ASF run. To Read more about this option, please visit https://github.com/JustArchiNET/ArchiSteamFarm/wiki

env.name: APP_KEY
env.label: APP_KEY
env.description:
The encryption key for your sessions. Keep this very secure.
Change it to a string of exactly 32 chars or use something like `php artisan key:generate` to generate it.
If you use Docker or similar, you can set this variable from a file by using APP_KEY_FILE

Avoid the '#' character in your APP_KEY, it may break things.

env.name: DB_HOST
env.label: DB_HOST
env.description: The host of the database server.

env.name: DB_PORT
env.label: DB_PORT
env.description: The port of the database server.

env.name: DB_CONNECTION
env.label: DB_CONNECTION
env.description: The connection type of the database server. (mysql, pgsql, sqlite)

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.label: DB_DATABASE
env.description: The name of the database.

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.label: DB_USERNAME
env.description: The username of the database user.

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.label: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: The password of the database user.

env.name: TRUSTED_PROXIES
env.label: TRUSTED_PROXIES
env.description:
TRUSTED_PROXIES is a useful variable when using Docker and/or a reverse proxy.
Set it to ** and reverse proxies work just fine.

env.name: APP_URL
env.label: APP_URL
env.description: The URL of the application. only used to determine the URL of Firefly III when Firefly III is incapable of doing so: when using the command line or when drafting emails.

env.description: for UserID

env.description: for GroupID

env.label: TZ

env.name: URL
env.label: URL
env.description: Top url you have control over (customdomain.com if you own it, or customsubdomain.ddnsprovider.com if dynamic dns).

env.name: VALIDATION
env.label: VALIDATION
env.description: Certbot validation method to use, options are http or dns (dns method also requires DNSPLUGIN variable set).

env.name: SUBDOMAINS
env.label: SUBDOMAINS
env.description: Subdomains you'd like the cert to cover (comma separated, no spaces) ie. www,ftp,cloud. For a wildcard cert, set this exactly to wildcard (wildcard cert is available via dns validation only)

env.name: EXTRA_DOMAINS
env.label: EXTRA_DOMAINS
env.description: Additional fully qualified domain names (comma separated, no spaces) ie. extradomain.com,subdomain.anotherdomain.org,*.anotherdomain.org

env.name: DNSPLUGIN
env.label: DNSPLUGIN
env.description: DNS plugin to use for dns validation (only required if using dns validation method)

env.name: EMAIL
env.label: EMAIL
env.description: Optional e-mail address used for cert expiration notifications (Required for ZeroSSL).

env.name: DOCKER_MODS
env.label: DOCKER_MODS
env.description: linuxserver Docker Mods

env.name: WATCHLIST
env.label: WATCHLIST
env.description: To be used with linuxserver/mods:swag-auto-reload

env.name: MAXMIND_LICENSE_KEY
env.label: MAXMIND_LICENSE_KEY
env.description: MaxMind License Key

env.name: CERTPROVIDER
env.label: CERTPROVIDER
env.description: Optionally define the cert provider. Set to zerossl for ZeroSSL certs (requires existing ZeroSSL account and the e-mail address entered in EMAIL env var). Otherwise defaults to Let's Encrypt.

env.name: PROPAGATION
env.label: PROPAGATION
env.description: Optionally define the propagation time for DNS validation. Defaults to 60 seconds.

templates.description: This container sets up an Nginx webserver and reverse proxy with php support and a built-in letsencrypt client that automates free SSL server certificate generation and renewal processes. It also contains fail2ban for intrusion prevention, includes Authelia for SSO.
templates.name: swag-authelia
templates.title: SWAG with Authelia

templates.name: swag-crowdsec-authelia
templates.title: SWAG with Authelia and CrowdSec

env.description: for GroupID

env.description: Specify a timezone to use for example America/New_York

env.name: PLEX_SECTION
env.label: PLEX_SECTION
env.description: The library where your anime resides. Separate multiple libraries with a |

env.name: PLEX_URL
env.label: PLEX_URL
env.description: The address to your Plex Media Server, for example: http://127.0.0.1:32400

env.name: PLEX_TOKEN
env.label: PLEX_TOKEN
env.description: Follow [this guide](https://support.plex.tv/articles/204059436-finding-an-authentication-token-x-plex-token/)

env.name: ANI_USERNAME
env.label: ANI_USERNAME
env.description: Your AniList.co username

env.name: ANI_TOKEN
env.label: ANI_TOKEN
env.description: Get it [here](https://anilist.co/api/v2/oauth/authorize?client_id=1549&response_type=token)

env.name: PLEX_EPISODE_COUNT_PRIORITY
env.label: PLEX_EPISODE_COUNT_PRIORITY
env.description: If set to True, Plex episode watched count will take priority over AniList (default = False)

env.name: SKIP_LIST_UPDATE
env.label: SKIP_LIST_UPDATE
env.description: If set to True, it will NOT update your AniList which is useful if you want to do a test run to check if everything lines up properly. (default = False)

env.name: LOG_FAILED_MATCHES
env.label: LOG_FAILED_MATCHES
env.description: If set to True, failed matches will be written to /plexanisync/failed_matches.txt (default = False)

env.name: INTERVAL
env.label: INTERVAL
env.description: The time in between syncs in seconds

env.name: WATCHTOWER_SCHEDULE
env.label: WATCHTOWER_SCHEDULE
env.description: Cron expression in 6 fields (rather than the traditional 5) which defines when and how often to check for new images

env.name: TZ
env.label: TZ
env.description: Specify a timezone to use for example America/New_York

templates.description: With watchtower you can update the running version of your containerized app simply by pushing a new image to the Docker Hub or your own image registry. Watchtower will pull down your new image, gracefully shut down your existing container and restart it with the same options that were used when it was deployed initially.
templates.name: watchtower
templates.note: It is recommended to manually update your containers but we're including this for those of you that don't care
templates.title: Watchtower
